pullRequest.body:
These are new lemmas added to the file about proper maps.

---

These modifications were done during the conference "Lean for the curious mathematician" 2024.

nodes.body: Thanks for your quick feedback!
If you are satisfied don't forget to remove the "WIP" label and add "awaiting review". You can also choose the "topology" label.
Thanks! I hope I added the new lemma in the right place.

I would put a bit further down, next to `mapClusterPt_of_comp` since it is not about the definition itself. But it can also stay there.

bors d+

:v: EtienneC30 can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8492177818/job/23264915589)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8492177818/job/23264915485)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8492177818/job/23264915764)
Nice work!

Thanks a lot, this looks very good! My comments are mostly stylistic as well as some suggestions to shorten some proofs.

As I told you I don't want to be the one merging this since I've supervised you during the week, but feel free to add the `awaiting-review` tag as soon as you've addressed my comments so that someone else can finish the review.
Nice work!
`f` and `g` are already in scope I think
If after this line you have more than one goal, can you separate them using dots?

Same here, if at some you have more than one goal it's better (for readability) to use `·`: since the first one is very short, you can do something like
```lean
· ... --short proof
... --longer proof

```suggestion
  refine ⟨f x, hx1, neBot_of_comap (m := f) (NeBot.mono hx2 ?_)⟩
```
Feel free to apply this or not. It is mainly to show you that is possible to short proofs if you want (for example sometimes the math is completely trivial, but if you think the previous proof is more readable let's keep it).

```suggestion
  rw [← inf_top_eq ℱ, ← principal_univ, ← f_surj.range_eq, ← ℱ.map_comap f, MapClusterPt,
    map_map, ← MapClusterPt] at h
```
`Filter` is opened, so there is no need to write it (maybe this is not the only place where you can erase it).

Small practical trick: in a `rcases` pattern, you can write `rfl` to immediately rewrite by an equality where one of the sides is a variable. This is very useful when dealing with all the statements of the form `∃ x, y = f x ∧ ...`, which come up very often.

Combined with the fact that `use` can take multiple arguments, and calls `assumption` at the end, you can shorten this to:
```suggestion
  rcases hg.clusterPt_of_mapClusterPt h with ⟨y, rfl, hy2⟩
  rcases hf.clusterPt_of_mapClusterPt hy2 with ⟨x, rfl, hx2⟩
  use x, rfl
```

This is a very minor stylistic comment: notice that the `_` still introduces an (unnamed) hypothesis, which clutters the goal view and may still be used by tactics later. Instead, you could do the following to completely discard this hypothesis:
```suggestion
  rcases hgf with ⟨-, h'⟩
```

Another solution, maybe better, would be to directly use `hgf.clusterPt_of_mapClusterPt` where you use `h'`.

This applies to other occurrences of the same pattern below.

You can use [Filter.map_comap_of_surjective](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Order/Filter/Basic.html#Filter.map_comap_of_surjective) directly here:
```suggestion
  rw [← ℱ.map_comap_of_surjective f_surj, MapClusterPt, map_map, ← MapClusterPt] at h
```

You can simplify this a bit by using again the equality `ℱ = map f (comap f ℱ)`, together with [ClusterPt.map](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Topology/Basic.html#ClusterPt.map):
```suggestion
  rw [← ℱ.map_comap_of_surjective f_surj]
  exact ⟨f x, hx1, hx2.map hf.continuousAt tendsto_map⟩
```

```suggestion
  have : MapClusterPt (g y) ℱ (g ∘ f) := h.map hg.continuousAt tendsto_map
```

Two things here:
- As you noticed, `ContinuousAt` unfolds to a `Tendsto` statement. Still, it's a bit cleaner to use `hg.continuousAt` directly, rather than `hg.tendsto`.
- It turns out the functoriality of `map` is definitional, so you can (ab)use it and use [Filter.tendsto_map](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Order/Filter/Basic.html#Filter.tendsto_map) directly. If you're not happy with this feel free to ignore.

This is fine, but you could also write it as a composition of limits directly:
```suggestion
  have : Tendsto (g ∘ f) ↑𝒰 (𝓝 (g y)) := (hg.tendsto y).comp h
```

Could you also deduce [Homeomorph.isProperMap](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Topology/ProperMap.html#Homeomorph.isProperMap) from this? I think you can safely move it down the file.

```suggestion
/-- An injective and continuous function is proper if and only if it is closed. -/
```

```suggestion
/-- A homeomorphism is proper. -/
```

In this lemma and the previous one, there is too much definitional rewriting going on. This is the signal that a stupid lemma is missing. Something like:
```lean
lemma mapClusterPt_comp {X α β : Type*} {x : X} [TopologicalSpace X] {F : Filter α} {φ : α → β}
    {u : β → X} : MapClusterPt x F (u ∘ φ) ↔ MapClusterPt x (map φ F) u := Iff.rfl
```
that should go in an earlier file, very close to the definition of `MapClusterPt`.
Last small comment from me: since you're using `hU.closedEmbedding_subtype_val`, why not use the `ClosedEmbedding` version of the lemma?

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: new lemmas about proper maps in Mathlib.Topology.ProperMap
